title: Missing frontmatter in skill definition
description:
The docs-update skill lacks YAML frontmatter (---) at the beginning of the file. All other skills follow the pattern of starting with `---
name: <skill_name>
description: <description>
---` but this file starts directly with markdown content. This breaks skill discovery and metadata parsing.
recommendation:
Add YAML frontmatter at the top of the file: `---
name: docs-update
description: Automatically update documentation artifacts when markdown files change
---`
evidence: File starts with '# docs-update Skill' instead of YAML block
All other skills have frontmatter (verified: audit-code, code-reviewer, session-begin, session-end)
Skill parser likely expects frontmatter for extraction

title: References non-existent Python scripts with incorrect path
description: The skill references Python scripts (pr_analyzer.py, code_quality_checker.py, review_report_generator.py) with paths like `scripts/pr_analyzer.py`. However, these scripts actually exist at `.claude/skills/code-reviewer/scripts/pr_analyzer.py`. The relative path context is misleading since the skill is run from the codebase root.
recommendation: Update script paths in SKILL.md to use full paths: `./.claude/skills/code-reviewer/scripts/pr_analyzer.py` or document the scripts are co-located in the skill directory (not in root /scripts)
evidence: Line 23: `python scripts/pr_analyzer.py [options]`
Verified: scripts exist at `./.claude/skills/code-reviewer/scripts/`
Would fail if executed from repo root: `python scripts/pr_analyzer.py` returns 'No such file'

title: References non-existent scientific-schematics skill
description: Skill documentation references a scientific-schematics skill that does not exist in the codebase. Section 'Visual Enhancement with Scientific Schematics' directs users to invoke a skill that is not available: 'Use the **scientific-schematics** skill to generate AI-powered publication-quality diagrams'. This creates broken workflows.
recommendation: Either: (1) Remove the scientific-schematics section entirely if the skill is out of scope, (2) Create the scientific-schematics skill with referenced functionality, or (3) Replace with specific instructions for diagram generation without delegating to non-existent skill
evidence: Line 36-70: Entire section references scientific-schematics skill
Grep search finds no scientific-schematics skill directory in .claude/skills/
market-research-reports template references non-existent script path: `scripts/scientific-schematics/scripts/generate_schematic.py`

title: References non-existent TDMS intake script
description: Step 6 (Post-Audit) instructs users to run `node scripts/debt/intake-audit.js` to ingest findings. However, this appears to be aspirational or legacy instruction - the script path follows a specific pattern but may not exist or may be incomplete. Without this script, findings cannot be properly ingested into the TDMS system.
recommendation: Verify scripts/debt/intake-audit.js exists and functions correctly. If not: (1) Create the script with full TDMS integration capability, (2) Update docs to point to correct script location, or (3) Remove this step with explicit note that TDMS integration is manual for now
evidence: Line 309: `node scripts/debt/intake-audit.js docs/audits/single-session/code/...`
MANDATORY integration step claims to assign DEBT-XXXX IDs and add to canonical store
If script missing, critical workflow step will fail and data loss occurs

title: Outdated MCP protocol documentation URL
description: Skill instructs users to fetch MCP protocol documentation from `https://modelcontextprotocol.io/llms-full.txt` (line 77) but also references older fetching patterns. The protocol URL structure may have changed, and users will receive outdated or incorrect specification information if this URL is stale.
recommendation: Verify the MCP documentation URL is current and correct before recommending it. Update to latest canonical source or provide multiple reference sources. Consider caching a known-good version of the spec alongside the skill.
evidence: Line 77: Fetch from 'https://modelcontextprotocol.io/llms-full.txt'
Line 93: Different URL pattern for Python SDK: 'raw.githubusercontent.com'
Protocol versioning not specified - users may get mismatched SDK/spec combinations

title: Template file path reference lacks absolute path clarity
description: Skill references template location as 'requesting-code-review/code-reviewer.md' but doesn't clarify if this is relative to .claude/skills or another location. When users invoke this skill from different working directories, the relative path may break.
recommendation: Specify absolute path: './.claude/skills/requesting-code-review/code-reviewer.md' or provide explicit 'This template is located in <FULL_PATH>' statement
evidence: Line 118: 'See template at: requesting-code-review/code-reviewer.md'
Inconsistent with other skills which use full file path references

title: References non-existent npm scripts without validation
description: Skill instructs users to run multiple npm scripts (npm run patterns:check, npm run review:check, npm run lessons:surface) but provides no verification that these scripts exist in package.json. If any script is missing, users will encounter errors during the mandatory session startup process.
recommendation: Add explicit validation step: 'Verify scripts exist: `npm run 2>&1 | grep -E (patterns:check|review:check|lessons:surface)`. If missing, note as N/A in audit'
evidence: Lines 206-213: Lists 3 required npm scripts
No npm run list verification provided
Session cannot proceed if scripts fail but no error recovery documented

title: Incomplete MCP tool reference without fallback
description: Step 1.5 (SonarCloud Enrichment) instructs to use `mcp__sonarcloud__<tool>` placeholder but doesn't specify which tool to use or provide fallback if MCP is unavailable. Incomplete instruction creates ambiguous workflow.
recommendation: Specify exact MCP tool name (e.g., `mcp__sonarcloud__get_issues`) and add fallback instruction: 'If MCP unavailable, use manual SonarCloud API curl command below'
evidence: Line 199: 'mcp__sonarcloud__<tool>' is placeholder, not executable
No indication which specific sonarcloud tool is required
No error handling if MCP not configured

title: Cross-reference to non-existent superpowers skill
description: Skill references 'superpowers:test-driven-development' skill at line 191-192 but this appears to use outdated naming convention. Other skills in codebase use different naming patterns (e.g., other superpowers references). Unclear if this skill exists or if reference should point elsewhere.
recommendation: Verify the exact skill name and update reference. Either update to current skill name or replace with explicit test case creation instructions inline
evidence: Line 191: 'Use the `superpowers:test-driven-development` skill'
Inconsistent with other skill references in codebase
No superpowers directory found in .claude/skills verify naming

title: Skill description lacks execution clarity
description: The YAML description claims to provide 'automated code analysis, best practice checking, security scanning' but the skill itself is primarily documentation pointing to reference files. The description oversells automation capabilities that are actually manual workflows.
recommendation: Update description to accurately reflect skill capabilities: 'Comprehensive code review guide with reference materials, checklists, and automation recommendations. Includes manual review procedures and integration with external tools.'
evidence: Line 3-8: Claims 'automated' analysis and scanning
Actual skill (lines 12-83): Provides references to documentation and external scripts
Users expecting CLI tool will be disappointed

title: Complex deduplication logic lacks implementation guidance
description: Skill provides extensive pseudo-code and theoretical deduplication logic but lacks clear executable instructions. Step 2 deduplication requires sophisticated JSON parsing and merging logic that is not provided as actual scripts or code examples.
recommendation: Either: (1) Provide actual JavaScript/Node.js implementation of deduplication logic, (2) Reference existing scripts that implement this logic, or (3) Simplify to more manual process with clear step-by-step instructions for humans
evidence: Lines 85-133: Extensive pseudo-code with JavaScript syntax
No indication if logic is automated script or manual procedure
Lines 88-111: Complex merging logic without actual implementation provided

title: Bash grep commands lack proper error handling
description: Step 2 (Pre-Audit Validation) provides shell commands using grep without error handling or validation. Commands like `npm test 2>&1 | grep -E ...` may fail silently or return incorrect counts if grep patterns don't match expected output format.
recommendation: Add error handling: Set `set -e` at top of script block, add `|| echo 'WARNING: [command] failed'`, provide expected output format example so users can verify correctness
evidence: Lines 24-34: Multiple grep commands without error checking
Example: `npm test 2>&1 | grep -E "Tests:|passing|failed"`
Output format dependency not documented - what if test runner uses different format?
